page.title: 04No more roads works in 1985.
page.content: Drivers have been assured that there will be no major road works on the Staffordshire stretch of the M6 before April next year (1986). This will be the first year since 1976 that motorists,have not had to worry about delays and tailbacks caused by motorways maintenance. The entire Staffordshire section of the M6 has been reconstructed since 1976, apart from a section of flexible constuction between Gailey and junction 11 at Shareshill and a concrete stretch linking junction 13 at Dunston and junction 12 at Gailey which is still in good condition.A spokesman for Staffordshire County Council said the only work to be carried out this year would be a contract to replace some badly deteriorated sections on the southbound carriageway at Waltons Wood.
